entry.title: üßµCL_SALV_TABLE ‚Äî Sele√ß√£o com ROW_COLUMN n√£o mant√©m refer√™ncia na impress√£o
entry.content:
üí° Dica √∫til

üí•Ocorreu ap√≥s a migra√ß√£o ECC / S4 üí•

Hoje me deparei com um comportamento curioso usando SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>ROW_COLUMN ) no CL_SALV_TABLE. Ao tentar imprimir as linhas selecionadas com:

lo_selections = o_alv->get_selections( ).
lt_rows = lo_selections->get_selected_rows( ).


"Notei que a refer√™ncia da sele√ß√£o se perdia ap√≥s o usu√°rio clicar em 'Imprimir' e, depois, executar alguma rotina que dependia da sele√ß√£o de linhas. As linhas selecionadas n√£o eram preservadas como esperado. Testei trocar para:"

SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>MULTIPLE )

üü¢ Troquei para MULTIPLE e resolveu! As linhas selecionadas passaram a ser capturadas certinho na impress√£o. Fica a dica: se voc√™ precisa garantir que a sele√ß√£o funcione como esperado, esse modo √© muito mais confi√°vel.
‚ö†Ô∏è Vale lembrar que a CL_SALV_TABLE n√£o tem suporte direto pra capturar colunas selecionadas ‚Äî diferente da CL_GUI_ALV_GRID, que d√° bem mais controle nesse ponto. Ent√£o, se voc√™ precisa dessa precis√£o, talvez seja hora de considerar a migra√ß√£o.

entry.title: Re: Loans Management - Inter-company loans
entry.content:
Hi,

Yes, you can handle this kind of intercompany loan scenario in SAP, though it does require some setup:

üîπ Basic Approach:

  • In Company A, post the outgoing bank transaction as a loan asset (e.g., to a G/L account like ‚ÄúIntercompany Loans Receivable‚Äù).

  • In Company B, post the incoming transaction as a loan liability (e.g., ‚ÄúIntercompany Loans Payable‚Äù).

You‚Äôll need to manually assign and match repayments unless you're using automation.

üîπ Suggested Process:

  1. Set up loan accounts in both company codes.

  2. Use Document Type & Posting Keys for proper classification.

  3. Track repayments using reference fields or loan IDs.

  4. Use Recurring Entries or Contract Management if the loan has scheduled payments.

üîπ Want automation?

If you‚Äôre looking for structured management contracts, interest calculation, and tracking, you might consider intercompany loan software , especially if managing multiple subsidiaries and group-level treasury operations.

Let me know what version of SAP you‚Äôre on‚Äîfeatures can vary a bit between ECC and S/4HANA.
https://dnetsoft.com/treasury-management-software-dynamics

entry.title: üßµCL_SALV_TABLE ‚Äî Lost selection reference when printing using ROW_COLUMN
entry.content:
‚ÄúProblem occurred after ECC/S4 migration.

Today I ran into a strange behavior while using SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>ROW_COLUMN ) in CL_SALV_TABLE. When trying to print selected rows using:

 

lo_selections = o_alv->get_selections( ).

lt_rows = lo_selections->get_selected_rows( ).

üö® I noticed that the selection reference was lost ‚Äî selected columns weren‚Äôt preserved as expected. I switched to:

 

SET_SELECTION_MODE( IF_SALV_C_SELECTION_MODE=>MULTIPLE )

 

üü¢ That did the trick! The selected rows were printed correctly, even when using the Quartz theme (which doesn‚Äôt visually show the selection column). So here‚Äôs the tip: if you need reliable selection tracking, the MULTIPLE mode is much more stable.

üîç Unfortunately, CL_SALV_TABLE doesn‚Äôt offer a way to retrieve selected columns like CL_GUI_ALV_GRID does. If you need that level of detail, it might be worth considering a migration.

Has anyone else faced this? Got workarounds to share? Let‚Äôs talk! üí¨

 

Se quiser posso transformar isso num carrossel pra LinkedIn ou formatar com visuais. S√≥ dar o toque, Felipe! üë®‚Äçüíªüí°

entry.title: Leveraging SAP S/4HANA for Tank Planning and -Scheduling
entry.content:
In the complex world of supply chain and production planning, managing resources effectively becomes crucial. For businesses faced with tank constraints, such as consumer products (e.g. beverages and dairies), chemicals, oil and gas, or pharmaceuticals, tank scheduling forms an important part of their operations, and this is where SAP PP/DS comes into play. These industries often involve continuous or batch processes where storage and handling of liquids in tanks require precise scheduling and resource optimization. SAP Production Planning and Detailed Scheduling (PP/DS) is an integral part of SAP S/4HANA, which can significantly improve tank scheduling efficiency. Let's dive deeper to explore how PP/DS helps address tank scheduling challenges.

Optimized Resource Allocation
PP/DS in S/4HANA offers a detailed representation of the manufacturing process, including tank scheduling. It uses sophisticated algorithms for production planning and detailed scheduling based on real-time data, ensuring optimal resource allocation. The resources, in this case, include storage / buffer tanks, which may have different capacities, may be intended for different materials, and may be placed at different parts of the production network. SAP PP/DS takes all these factors into account while scheduling, leading to efficient utilization of resources and overall cost reduction.

Improved Inventory Management
Effective tank scheduling requires efficient inventory management. SAP PP/DS in S/4HANA provides capabilities to track tank usage, monitor inventory levels, and show future usage based on production plans. By accurately modelling the flow of materials into and out of storage tanks, PP/DS ensures that the production schedule aligns with tank availability, avoiding overflows or shortages. This not only helps in preventing stockouts but also safeguards against overstocking, which might render tanks unusable for a certain period. This is crucial for operational efficiency and maintaining safety standards.

Automated Scheduling
In the traditional system, tank scheduling is a labour-intensive and time-consuming process, prone to errors. SAP PP/DS in S/4HANA simplifies this process by automating most of the tasks linked with tank scheduling. PP/DS also supports synchronization between production scheduling and inventory levels, helping process industries balance the demands for storage capacity with the availability of production inputs and outputs. This is essential for optimizing the use of tanks, where capacity utilization must align with production and shipping schedules. This automated process ensures higher accuracy, saving time and human resources for other critical tasks.

Real-Time Monitoring and Control
One of the most impactful benefits of SAP PP/DS in S/4HANA in tank scheduling is real-time monitoring and control. With real-time data, planning can be dynamic and responsive to the ever-changing demands and situations in the supply chain. The software also alerts users about any potential issues, ensuring timely intervention and resolution.

Moreover, PP/DS integrates seamlessly with other SAP solutions, facilitating better coordination across the overall supply chain, procurement, manufacturing, and distribution. This integration ensures consistent data flow and visibility, which is crucial for managing complex storage and production requirements in process industries.

Does all this sound familiar to you?
Even for long lasting SAP customers leveraging PP/DS in its legacy solution APO since decades, it was challenging to succeed without major customizations.

What is different with PP/DS in S/4HANA?
With embedding PP/DS in S/4HANA the capabilities for constrained based production planning and scheduling have been significantly increased. Tank planning and scheduling is part of the extended planning scope. Since 2020 SAP is delivering continuously superior functionality in this space which include:

  • Improved planning algorithms for storage constraints and resource networks (since S/4HANA 2020 and ongoing)
  • Better visualization of bucketed and detailed tank levels (S/4HANA 2021)
  • New Modelling capabilities such as raw material tanks addressing the purchasing process (external procurement and stock transfers) shipped with S/4HANA 2022
  • Improved detailed scheduling algorithms (started with S/4HANA 2022 and ongoing)
  • Improved interactive scheduling including tank splits (since S/4HANA 2023)

Beyond the mentioned highlights the solution growth for tank planning is shown in the following picture. Future plans and more details on many delivered innovations are documented in the roadmap explorer (PP/DS Roadmap ‚Äì extend selection for seeing past innovations).

 

Figure 1: Solution Growth for tank planning with PP/DS

 

Along with core planning and scheduling capabilities tank planning with PP/DS has also been improved for interactive planning with the FIORI-Gantt App ‚ÄúAdvanced Scheduling Board (ASB)‚Äù. Better visualization of filling / draining activities and a tank occupation indicator were already provided with earlier shipments. The upcoming planned release S/4HANA 2025 provides an integrated fill level view in the resource chart for better monitoring of detailed filling curves. ASB will also provide a user-based configuration of shapes in various charts of the Gantt-UI.

 

Figure 2: Advanced Scheduling Board (ASB) with fill level curve for tank resources

 

In summary, SAP PP/DS brings a lot to the table for effective and efficient tank scheduling. It supports batch and continuous productions scenarios with recipes and (discrete) routings. It not only streamlines the scheduling process but also ensures optimum resource usage and improved inventory management. The capabilities offered by SAP PP/DS can significantly reduce the manual effort and errors in tank scheduling, leading to smoother operations, significant time and cost savings, and enhancing the overall productivity of manufacturing companies. Adopting such technology is a compelling way forward to stay competitive and profitable in the evolving market dynamics.

entry.title: "set tracefile" doesn't display stored proc call params
entry.content:
I had a much longer question typed up, but when I choose a "board" for where to post this, the web page cleared out my text.

For finding slow queries you can execute the calls

  • set trace <filename> for <spid_to_trace>
  • set show_sqltext on  -- applies to spid_to_trace, not the current session
  • set show_<optimizer_option>
  • set tracefile off for <spid_to_trace>  -- very important, trace will continue after current session logs off

But the "set trace" command doesn't show parameters for stored proc calls.   Anyway to trace that info?

Thanks in advance
Ben

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About the SAP Young Professionals Program
entry.content:
If you‚Äôre an ambitious graduate looking to launch your tech consulting career, the SAP Young Professionals program might be the opportunity you‚Äôve been waiting for! This free, immersive training experience opens doors to become an SAP Associate Consultant and kick-start your career among SAP's. 

What is the SAP Young Professionals program?

It is a free, 2-3 month intensive training initiative from the SAP Digital Skills Center that aims to equip recent university graduates (with less than 3 years of graduation) with SAP knowledge, soft skills, and certifications that prepare them for SAP consulting-related position within the EMEA region. 

Graduates are trained in SAP technologies such as: SAP S/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, Artificial Intelligence, SAP Business Technology Platform, within others ((Modules may vary by cohort or region).

Who is eligible for the program?

Applicants typically need to meet the following criteria.

  • Hold a university degree (Bachelor‚Äôs or higher). 
  • Be a recent graduate (within the past 3 years).
  • Be currently unemployed or underemployed
  • Show strong English proficiency.
  • Be citizens or legal residents of the country where the program is being offered.

Note: Specific requirements may vary depending on country and region.

What does the program include?

Over the course of 2‚Äì3 months, participants will:

  • Earn globally recognized certifications 
  • Gain access to SAP Learning Hub and be trained by SAP specialists 
  • Develop soft skills
  • Have the possibility of starting your career as Associate Consultant in SAP's ecosystem (partners + customers)

Is the program really free?

Yes. The SAP Digital Skills Center delivers this program at no cost to participants as part of SAP‚Äôs mission to close the digital skills gap and support sustainable employment. SAP invests in rising talent to help drive digital transformation across industries.

Is employment guaranteed after completing the program?

While job placement is not guaranteed, one of the key goals of YPP is to connect graduates with SAP partners and customers who are actively hiring. Many graduates secure employment within the SAP ecosystem shortly after completing the program. However, success depends on the graduate's performance, certification results, and engagement throughout the course.

How to apply?

Applications are submitted via üëâ SAP Digital Skills Center portal.

Keep an eye on the website or SAP‚Äôs social media channels for announcements about new program cohorts in your region.

SAP Document and Reporting Compliance is SAP‚Äôs end-to-end solution to help businesses meet local legal requirements for electronic documents processing worldwide. It streamlines electronic invoicing, statutory reporting, and audit obligations across countries ‚Äì while enabling automation, scalability, and real-time compliance with confidence.

entry.title: Search Not Triggering on Enter in SAP Commerce Cloud 2211.3x using Composable Storefront
entry.content:
What is the issue?

If you‚Äôve recently upgraded to SAP Commerce Cloud 2211.3x, you might have noticed a frustrating glitch in your Composable Storefront: pressing Enter after typing in the search box doesn't trigger a product search as expected. Instead, the search only works if the user clicks back into the search field with the mouse.

This unintuitive behavior can create confusion for end users, if there are multiple search box components are in play across different parts of your Composable Storefront.

How to Reproduce the Issue

To see the issue in action, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to your Composable Storefront
  2. Navigate to a catalog with available products
  3. Enter a term such as "ProductA" into one of the search boxes
  4. Press Enter
  5. Observe that nothing happens
  6. Click inside the search box again with your mouse, and only then will the expected suggestions and results appear

Root Cause

This behavior is caused by a redundant search completion reset in the SearchBoxComponent. The logic mistakenly blocks the search trigger when using the Enter key, even though it works via mouse interaction.

Good news: the issue has been fixed in SAP Commerce Cloud version 2211.42. The solution includes:

  • Removal of the redundant reset logic in theSearchBoxComponent
  • Restored support for search activation via the Enter key

To resolve the issue in your environment, simply upgrade to version 2211.42 or later.

Additional Resources

For projects currently on 2211.3x or earlier and facing this issue, it's strongly recommended to plan an upgrade to benefit from the fix and ensure optimal storefront functionality.

Fixed Issues for Composable Storefront Version 2211.42

entry.title: EXTERNAL JOIN when using temporary tables
entry.content:
Hello Community,

once again I'm dealing with a weird problem. This is my current setup:

  • Crystal Reports Designer 2016 (I need 32-bit compatibility at the moment)
  • Crystal Reports Runtime 13.0.38
  • SAP SQL Anywhere 17
  • all reports connect the database using ODBC

Some reports use global temporary tables for printing. Since the Crystal Reports Designer cannot access temporary tables, I create a persistent table with the same name and schema first.

In my sample report, it looks like this:

Tables A and B are joined on the MasterId field. The report generates the expected SQL query from this:

After creating the report, I convert the persistent table B back to a temporary table.

If I perform a ‚ÄúVerify Database‚Äù using the same database after that, I get a message that the database has changed.

This is okay, but now the SQL query looks like this:

It does not matter whether ‚ÄúVerify Database‚Äù is executed in the Crystal Reports Designer or (at runtime) via the API.

As a result, a separate SELECT statement is executed on table B for each record in table A at runtime to determine the data from table B.

Depending on the data set and data model of the report, this can result in tens of thousands of queries being fired at the database instead of just one. And this results in dramatic performance losses.

Is there any way to prevent this from happening?

entry.title: Re: BUILD Work Zone - HTML5 Business Solutions vs HTML5 a...
entry.content:
Hi @FabioPagoti ,

If you're looking for a simple single-tenant Business Solution I'd start with -

  • Refer to the CommonDataModel in Section 3: https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/integrate-with-work-zone..html
  • Simple single tenant business solution: https://github.com/SAP-samples/build-workzone-integration/tree/main/standard/html5-content-provider-sample/ManageProducts

Unlike the the HTML5 Apps with the SaaS approuter, the above suggests maintaining a cdm.json file that contains your Common Data Model definition. you can refer to: https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-standard-edition/sap-build-work-zone-standard-edition/creating-cdm-json-file-for-multi-tenancy-html5-app?q=CDM for more details.
Once you deploy your mtar, you should be to integrate the Deployed single tenant business solution into Work Zone by creating a new "HTML5 Business Solution" from the Channel Manager.

Once you integrate your applications using the "HTML5 Business Solution", any subsequent deployment of you apps will update the content channel in Work Zone automatically, unlike the "HTML5 Apps" content provider where a manual refresh is required after the deployment.

Best,
Jawad

entry.title: Re: Change managers in LMS/LMS Admin side
entry.content:
Hello Lori,
Usually this is because the system identifies your employee as one that comes from SF (BIZX).
To change this try to change the value for field "User Source System", it comes as "SuccessFactors Platform" for employees that come from BIZX and "Learning" for employees that were created in LMS.

If you are passing your employees from SF to LMS, you can change it from Integration Center.
Otherwise, other option is to use the import tool , download the User template fill just the mandatory data, and use "Correct Source system" option, select Learning, and this should allow again to change the values directly from LMS.
Hope this can help.

Regards,

-Gerardo

Ismail

I am not aware of a similar API to check for story filter. But Story filter can be read using getDimensionFilters() of FileDatasource. Just try to console.log and see what it returns when you have "All" selected as selection. If it returns an array with All as the first member you can play around with array indexing.

https://help.sap.com/doc/1639cb9ccaa54b2592224df577abe822/release/en-US/index.html#FileDataSource_MgetDimensionFilters

Nikhil

entry.title: Need a Function Module for mass activation/inactivation of Measuring Point in SAP
entry.content:
Measuring Point can be marked active/inactive individually using tcode IK02> Measuring Point> Functions> Activate/Inactivate.
But for doing it for multiple measuring points at once in bulk- a function module is needed.
Need help in that regard.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Need a Function Module for mass activation/inactivati...
entry.content:
You can use transaction IK08 to deactivate multiple measuring points. Select multiple lines from the output list then use menu path 'Goto - Functions - Activate<>Inactivate - Deactivate'

There is a non-released function TABLE_IMPTT_UPDATE that could be incorporate into a custom utility program to activate/deactivate measuring points / counters.
Set INHB_MP_BI-POINT and IMPTT_UPD-POINT to the measuring point
Set IMPTT_UPD-POINT-INACT to X to deactivate the measuring point or ' ' space to activate

‰∏≠ÂõΩÊú¨Âú∞ÂåñË¥¢Âä°Êìç‰ΩúÊõ¥Êñ∞

‰∏≠ÂõΩËøáË¥¶ÂäüËÉΩÊõ¥Êñ∞

        Âú®Ë¥¢Âä°ÁÆ°ÁêÜÁöÑÁ≤æÁªÜÂåñÊµ™ÊΩÆ‰∏≠ÔºåÁ≤æÂáÜÁöÑË¥¶Âä°Â§ÑÁêÜÊòØ‰ºÅ‰∏öÁ®≥ÂÅ•ËøêËê•ÁöÑÂÖ≥ÈîÆ„ÄÇËá™2508ÁâàÊú¨Ëµ∑Ôºå‰∏≠ÂõΩÁî®Êà∑ÂèØ‰ª•Âú®ÊøÄÊ¥ªÁõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑËÆæÁΩÆ‰πãÂêéÔºåÂÆûÁé∞Ê∏ÖÂ∏êËøáÁ®ã‰∏≠ÁöÑË¥üËøáË¥¶„ÄÇ

        ËØ•ÂäüËÉΩÂ∞ÜÈÄöËøá‰∏∫Áõ∏ÂÖ≥Ê∏ÖÂ∏êÂá≠ËØÅÁöÑÂØπÂ∫îË°åÈ°πÁõÆÊâì‰∏äÂèçËÆ∞Ë¥¶Ê†áÁ≠æ‰πãÂêéÔºåÂ∑ßÂ¶ôÂú∞ÂÆûÁé∞Ê∏ÖÂ∏êÁßëÁõÆÁöÑÂÄüË¥∑ÊñπÂèëÁîüÈ¢ùÂÜ≤ÊäµÔºåÂêàËÆ°‰∏∫Èõ∂Ôºå‰ªéËÄåÊúâÊïàÂú∞ÈÅøÂÖç‰∫ÜÊ∏ÖÂ∏êÁßëÁõÆÁöÑÂèëÁîüÈ¢ùËôöÂ¢ûÁöÑÁé∞Ë±°ÔºåÁ°Æ‰øùË¥¢Âä°Êï∞ÊçÆÁöÑÁúüÂÆûÊÄßÂíåÂáÜÁ°ÆÊÄß„ÄÇ

        Áî®Êà∑È¶ñÂÖàÈúÄË¶ÅÂú®ÂõΩÂÆ∂ÁâàÊú¨‰∏≠ÂõΩ(CN)‰∏≠‰∏∫CNÊøÄÊ¥ªSSCUI: ÊøÄÊ¥ªÂõΩÂÆ∂/Âú∞Âå∫ÁöÑË¥üËøáË¥¶„ÄÇËØ∑Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºå‰∏≠ÂõΩÊú¨Âú∞ÂåñËøáË¥¶ÁöÑË¥üËøáË¥¶Ôºå‰æùÊóß‰∏•Ê†ºÈÅµÂæ™SAP ERPÊ†áÂáÜË¥¢Âä°ÂäüËÉΩ‰∏≠ÂØπË¥üËÆ∞Ë¥¶ÁöÑËßÑÂàôÂíåË¶ÅÊ±ÇÔºåÁ°Æ‰øùÊÇ®ÁöÑË¥¢Âä°ÊµÅÁ®ãÊó¢È´òÊïàÂèàÂêàËßÑ„ÄÇ

 Âõæ‰∏ÄÔºö‰∏≠ÂõΩÁâàÊú¨‰∏ãË¥üËÆ∞Ë¥¶Áõ∏ÂÖ≥ÁöÑSSCUI

entry.title: Receiving process enhancement
entry.content:
Due to the current workload and high volume of transactions, we are seeking your support and expertise to explore ways to improve the receiving process.

 

Currently, the process is carried out in two separate steps:

 

  • Step 1: Selecting the batch and expiry details.
  • Step 2: Creating the warehouse task and assigning a storage location for each line item.

 

We would like to know if it's possible to streamline these steps into a single process. Consolidating them could significantly reduce the workload and improve the efficiency of our receiving operations.

entry.title: Re: Change managers in LMS/LMS Admin side
entry.content:
Hello @Lori13 

 

The message in the user record indicates that these fields are read-only since they are not directly managed by Learning. Instead, they are sourced from other modules, and the data is updated according to the information passed to Learning via the connector input file. In this case, it is not possible to update them manually directly from the UI.

You can update these fields via the Import Data tool; however, please keep in mind that if the respective field is mapped in the connector, it will be overwritten once the connector runs and sends a value to it.

You mentioned that you can update the field in BizX, but for some reason, the change is not reflecting in LMS. Typically, in the connector mapping, we‚Äôll see sfuser.field.mapping.data.SUPER=MANAGER. This means that the BizX column SUPER is mapped to the Learning column MANAGER (Primary Manager). Please review (1) whether the column that contains the manager information in BizX is present in the user data file consumed by the learning connector, and (2) if the connector mapping is correct in Learning.

Best,

entry.title: Understanding the Difference Between Inventory Display and Future Stock Availability
entry.content:
SAP Commerce Cloud offers two features to manage and present stock-related information: Inventory Display and Future Stock Availability.

While both are focused on informing about product stock, they serve different purposes. Though they may appear similar at first glance, these features differ in goals, behavior, and configuration.

This blog aims to clarify the differences and help prevent confusion during implementation, configuration, or cross-team discussions.

So, what‚Äôs the difference between these two features?

Inventory Display ‚Äì Managing What‚Äôs Shown for Current Stock

The B2B Inventory Display feature allows showing a threshold value instead of the actual stock quantity available for a product.

Example:
If there are 100 units in stock and the threshold is set to 15, the storefront will display:

  • "15+ in stock"

If there are 15 or fewer units, the actual number will be shown:

  • "12 in stock"

Why use it?
To prevent a few customers from buying out all stock of popular products as soon as they become available. This helps:

  • Distribute stock more fairly across customers
  • Improve the overall customer experience
  • Prevent monopolization of high-demand items

How to configure:

By category:

  1. Open the Backoffice Administration Cockpit
  2. Go to Catalog > Categories
  3. Select the desired category
  4. Under the Administration tab, set the Stock Level Threshold

By site:

  1. Open the Backoffice Administration Cockpit
  2. Go to WCMS > Websites
  3. Select the desired site (e.g., powertools)
  4. Under the Administration tab, set the Default Inventory Threshold Value

üõ†Ô∏è This logic is handled by the commercefacades extension using the stockPopulator and VariantOptionDataStockPopulator.

Future Stock Availability ‚Äì Indicating Upcoming Restocks

Future Stock Availability shows when and how many units of a product will become available again. It provides visibility into planned restocks.

Example:
On the product page, a logged-in user may see:

  • July 20 ‚Äì 300 units
  • July 25 ‚Äì 500 units

‚ö†Ô∏èNote: This information is only visible to logged-in users. Anonymous users won‚Äôt see the Future Availability link.

Why use it?
To inform users about upcoming inventory and support purchasing decisions, especially when a product is currently out of stock.

How to configure:

Configure future stock values in Backoffice > Base Commerce > Futurestock, where quantities and dates are assigned to SKUs.

Technical behavior:

  • Managed by the FutureStockFacade
  • Handled by the ProductPageController
  • SKUs are processed as lists, not individually

Returns:

  • null if the system isn‚Äôt configured
  • An empty list if no future stock exists for the SKU(s)

How to disable it:

Future stock is enabled by default, but can be disabled via local.properties:

storefront.products.futurestock.enabled=false

Why Doesn‚Äôt Threshold Apply to Future Stock?

This is a frequent, and understandable, point of confusion.

If current stock displays ‚Äú25+‚Äù based on a threshold, why does future stock show ‚Äú99999‚Äù instead of applying the same rule?

The answer lies in the purpose of each feature. Inventory Display is a UI layer to strategically control how current stock is shown.  Future Stock Availability displays the exact restock quantity and date, meant for forecasting, not visibility control. Since its goal is transparency rather than display control, threshold logic is not applied to future stock data.

Final Thoughts:

While both features relate to stock display, they solve different business problems:

  • Inventory Display ‚Äì Focused on strategic visibility and stock protection
  • Future Stock Availability ‚Äì Focused on transparency and purchase planning

It‚Äôs common to expect both features to behave the same way, but this distinction is intentional, each was designed with a different purpose, and their behavior reflects this. That said, feedback is always welcome and can help shape future improvements.

entry.title: Re: Accidental Use of ‚ÄúMaintain GR/IR Clearing Account‚Äù A...
entry.content:
Hello @Monali 

The user incorrectly used (App ID: F0842A)/Example: Maintenance of GR/IR Clearing Accounts and the Impact on Commitments, resulting in manual clearing of GR balances without corresponding invoices. This disrupts GR/IR reconciliation and blocks invoice posting via MIRO/automatic processes.

Correction (SAP-Recommended)

    Post Reversal via Journal Entry App ID: F0717A ‚Äì Manage Journal Entries (New Version)

 This restores the financial balance but does not reopen the GR line in PO history.

Reversal Limitation:

  • No equivalent to FBRA in Public Cloud
  • MIGO/102 movement type not available for GR reversal

Optional: Raise an incident via SAP for me if multiple POs are impacted or if there's a need to adjust integration-dependent processes.

Let me know if it works

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: "cannot specify a NULL Key value for reference entity...
entry.content:
Hi @user116 

The exception message "Cannot specify a NULL Key value for reference entity STUD_ID" usually occurs due to file formatting issues, such as incorrect delimiters, misaligned columns, or incorrect end-of-line symbols. Please review the connector input file to confirm whether you notice any of these issues. To verify whether the correct connector template is being used, please refer to Downloading Learning Connector Templates.

Best,
